justification: The Methods section notes that participants "undertook an abbreviated Moral Foundations Questionnaire (MFQ)" that included items "pertaining to Loyalty" to obtain their Loyalty scores.
The paper states that the same abbreviated MFQ contained questions "pertaining to... Fairness (α = .60)", indicating Fairness was assessed with the MFQ.

Study 2 reports that participants completed a Big Five Inventory where "BFI were shortened such that participants only answered the questions pertaining to... Openness (α = .81)", confirming Openness was measured with the BFI.
The manuscript explains that the shortened Big Five Inventory included items for "Conscientiousness (α = .84)", showing Conscientiousness was assessed using the BFI.
